name: Greek Roasted Pork Chops
description: This low-carb, nutritious, tasty meal is an easy pleaser. You can marinate chops in the fridge up to 6 hours ahead, or freeze a double batch for an easy meal next week.
preparation: Place chops and 1⁄2 cup Greek Dressing in a sealable freezer bag. Turn several times to coat chops evenly.

Discard marinade, and place chops on a Sheet Pan lined with a Sheet Pan Liner. Roast until cooked through, approximately 10–15 minutes. Alternatively, grill chops over medium-high heat, turning once, for approximately 8–10 minutes. Brush with remaining Greek Dressing during last 2 minutes of cooking.
Let chops rest for 5 minutes before serving.
tips: For a quick, mess-free chop dinner in minutes, microwave boneless marinated chops in a Multipurpose Steamer on medium for 5–7 minutes.
